comments.html: Avaya solutions with its Nortel heritage of smlt?
comments.name: David

comments.html:
Unless they developed something new, it falls under "two-box MLAG solutions from other vendors". Will mention it (and ALU) together with vPC during the presentation.

The coverage in the webinar will be more extensive, but I need some help - at least point me to a recent set of documentation, I can take it from there.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
You can check here Avaya VSP 9000 here:
http://support.avaya.com/css/P8/documents/100144394
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: Thanks for the link. Seems they made decent progress, SMLT is now functionally (almost) identical to vPC, the only difference might be active-active HSRP support in NX-OS (I understood the documents saying that with SMLT only one switch forwards off-subnet traffic through VRRP address).
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Ivan SMLT has supported VRRP Backup Master for years now (before 2006).
http://support.avaya.com/css/P8/documents/100100303
comments.name: Anonymous
